title: CloudSlang flows fail on External OO RAS
content:
CloudSlang flows fail to complete on External OO RAS and display the following message: Failed to download resources using Maven.

Cause

A possible cause of this issue is that the External OO RAS is behind a proxy server and the properties of the proxy server are set in <RAS_HOME>/conf/ras-wrapper.conf file but not in <RAS_HOME>/ras/maven/conf/settings.xml file.

Solution

  1. Navigate to <RAS_HOME>/ras/maven/conf/settings.xml
  2. Add the following structure to your proxy settings values: 
    <proxies>
   <proxy>
      <id>io-cloudslang-proxy</id>
      <active>true</active>
      <protocol>_supply_protocol_here_</protocol>
      <host>_supply_host_here_</host>
      <port>_supply_port_here</port>
   </proxy>
</proxies>

    The host tag can contain an actual host value or a variable. If a variable, for example ${proxy.host} is set, then the actual host value will be read from the ras-wrapper.conf file.
  3. In ras-wrapper.conf add the following line making sure to increment the last number:
    wrapper.java.additional.XX=-Doverride.csMavenSettings=false
  4. Start an External OO RAS service.

If, after following the changes above, intermittent Maven errors still appear, it is advisable to add extra profile properties as below:

<properties>
  <maven.artifact.threads>1</maven.artifact.threads>
  <connectionTimeout>60000</connectionTimeout>
  <requestTimeout>60000</requestTimeout>
</properties>

Make sure to start the External OO RAS service.
